intro: Endoloma, commonly known as the "Mexican thistle," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants typically have spiny stems and small, yellowish or whitish flowers arranged in composite heads. Endoloma species are often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain regions. Their botanical characteristics make them important subjects for ecological and taxonomic studies.
